Really, there's no sign of PepperFlash plugin inside the package. So this might be the packager's error for not including PepperFlash inside package. Manual copy does not solve problem at all, and `navigator.plugins` is still an empty list.
Nope, even from this path. `navigator.plugins` is also empty.
Can you open a fresh downloaded Electron and see if `navigator.plugins` is in the default app? I think you are disabling plugins in your app.

Default app is not compressed btw, so `navigator.plugins` list is populated properly. The problem occurs only if app is packaged under MacOS X.
Actually, I don't disable any plugins at all, as it's seen in the sample: https://github.com/hokein/electron-sample-apps/tree/master/pepper-flash-plugin.

The build string is: `electron-packager ./ PepperDemo --platform=darwin --version=0.30.3 --arch=x64 --overwrite`
Does file `PepperDemo.app/Contents/Frameworks/PepperDemo Helper EH.app/Contents/MacOS/PepperDemo Helper EH` exist on your machine? From the log you have generated a bad app.

Sad but true, it does not exit, there's `Electron Helper EH` file only  inside MacOS folder.
But, there is not any option for electron-packager to include or exclude plugins from app package.
So it is the packager's fault.

The electron-packager seems to work fine on my machine, and you have to generate a correct app to make plugins work.

I'm closing since it is caused by app not correctly generated, please report back if you have correctly bundled your app and the plugins are still not working.

Do you use the same command string for packager as I do? 
Should I set the app-bundle-id and helper-bundle-id for getting the "correct" app build?
